pros: They will never fire you because they are so understaffed.

pros: flexible scheduling and opportunities to work from home

review_title: Great place to get experience in social services
job_title: Community Support Worker in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Good experience, the pay is above industry standard, get to meet a lot of interesting people, coworkers are generally friendly and helpful.
cons: Gossip is an issue. The work experience is largely dependent upon your manager; either they are a micromanager or they treat you as an equal. The hours of work are not that desirable. Nepotism is an issue. You will find that everyone is either a friend of or knew the hiring manager before being hired.

pros: Very client centred and promotes independence
cons: I haven’t experienced any cons

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Randolph, NY
pros:
Great employees & employer.
Good pay.
Excellent opportunity to work with children who need guidance, and make a positive difference in their lives.
cons: Occasional negative attitudes from other employees, but can be resolved through communication.

pros: Great Team Atmosphere, Ample Time Off!
cons: It is a great place to work

pros: I am a passionate person and I love supporting individuals in any way I can so that is how I give back to the society.
cons: The staff needs proper compensation for the hard work they put in.

pros: good atmosphere, overtime pay is nice, have PTO
cons: can have a lot of clients and sessions but you get overtime

pros: Diverse, cooperative and friendly staff.
cons: The salary for teachers is lower than what you would earn in a local school district.

pros: The best environment I have ever worked at...
cons: There is absolutely nothing wrong

pros: Enjoy work with people any varsity health issues

pros: REWARDING job for the teachers and staff that are at the school for the right reasons.
cons: Lacking administrative strength. No follow ups, and unwelcoming and not approachable admin atmosphere.

pros: I used to love working here! The people were amazing, the job seemed fun and challenging at times! I felt helpful with assisting foster kids and making memories with them.
cons: After a few months, things went down hill. People gossip badly, management can’t handle certain flaws. We never got a bonus we were promised. The kids were very mentally and physically abusive.

pros: Meaningful employment provided by career. You genuinely have the opportunity to help people with the work you perform. Mission of the company has it's heart in the right place.
cons: High turnover in counseling staff due to low pay and high burnout work. This is the type of field that should pay double what it does considering the value it can have on society.

pros: The kids are great and they provide a lot of training on how to work well with the children. They allow you to come up with ideas for activities to do with the children  and they allow you to sign up for what hours you want.
cons: Blatant favoritism among staff, unprofessional staff, staff aren't trained well enough on the effects of childhood trauma

job_title: Former Youth Counselor in Lockport, NY
pros: The company (people higher up the company ladder) seems as if they genuinely care about the well-being of at-risk youth.
cons: Lack of communication between supervisors and staff; upper management doesn't know what supervisors are doing; supervisors discriminate/retaliate if confronted by staff (happened to me.) Social workers do bare minimum for the kids and turn them against certain people during their sessions.

review_title: The company tried to support youth and counselors and worked hard at keeping a consistent culture.
pros:
People who I worked with were always enduring and very helpful.
There were events and times when the job felt rewarding.
cons:
The nature of the work can be demanding both emotionally and physically. 
Pay is fair if low.
Ride a fine line between care worker and disciplinarian can be stressful

review_title: Great company to work for. Flexible, respectful of employees, and great pay.
pros: Great pay, very flexible schedule. This is a really great company to work for, as a second job.
cons: Training is a week long. If you have another job, this may be tough. It took a long time to actually start working.

pros: Average pay and benefits but a decent amount of paid time off.
cons: A lot of office politics.  Management talks a good game but does not follow through on aspired values and stated culture.

review_title: You need to be strong emotionally
